CIRC: Spectrum Sharing Sandbox (S3)

A 6 GHz and CBRS Data Platform for Advancing Spectrum Coexistence.

Spectrum Sharing Sandbox (S3) will provide the CISE community with a unique platform: CBRS and Wi-Fi 6E deployed in multiple indoor and outdoor locations at the University of Notre Dame in South Bend.

S3 will leverage commercial equipment, with special access to base-station and access point parameters such as channel lists for CBRS and sensing thresholds for Wi-Fi, through collaborations with industry partners.

User devices will be smartphones and laptops (with Wireshark and 6 GHz Wi-Fi cards) and measurement tools will be Qualipoc, SigCap, speedtests and spectrum analyzers. All data collected on the deployment will be made available to the CISE community.
